subclassFeature.name: Smooth Criminal
entries: Some rogues enhance their fine-honed skills of stealth and agility with magic, learning the bard secrets of preformance. These rogues include burglars, pranksters, mischief-makers, and a significant number of adventurers.

subclassFeature.name: Smooth Moves
entries: Starting at 3rd Level, when you use a cunning action you gain flight speed of 20 ft until the end of your turn, you may apply a dash actions bonus to this movement.

items: If you end your turn in the air you gently glide down 15 ft per turn until you reach the ground
If you take damage while in the air you must make a Dex Saving throw DC 1/4(damage taken rounded up) + 10  in order to prevent yourself from falling
you may not concentrate while using smooth moves, nor can you make non-lethal attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you gain the ability to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and {@book chapter 11|PHB|11} for the {@filter bard spell list|spells|class=bard}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn three cantrips: {@spell minor illusion} and two other cantrips of your choice from the bard spell list. You learn another bard cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Smooth Criminal Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter bard spells|spells|class=bard} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell charm person} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell charm person} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level bard spells of your choice

The Spells Known column of the Smooth Criminal Spellcasting table shows when you learn more bard spells of 1st level or higher, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the bard spells you know with another spell of your choice from the bard spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your bard spells, since you learn your spells through preformace and charisma. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a bard spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Off the Wall
entries: Starting at 9th level,While using smooth moves you have advantage on Dex based skill and ability checks and you may concentrate on spells while using smooth moves

subclassFeature.name: Beat It
entries: Once per turn when you use smooth moves, you may make a weapon attack with advantage at the nearest enemy; You may not apply sneak attack to this attack.

subclassFeature.name: Moon Walk
entries: Once per long rest when you use smooth moves, you may grant 3 other creatures the benefits of smooth moves on their next turn.
Smooth Moves' movement becomes 40 ft and creatures have disadvantage on ranged attacks they make against you.
